content.description: This route is the route located on the upper tier of 'The Blonde Formation'. Although the guidebook says 7 bolts for this route, I came across only 6. The scramble to the base of the route includes a lot of loose rock and a 4th Class section onto the actual rock, this is a bad place for your belayer to be if you fall, so perhaps try to belay from the ground somehow, may be difficult. The first bolt is a little ways up so be careful. This route I give 1 star if it were a little cleaner, as it was covered with a layer of sand/lichen when I climbed it, don't think it sees much action. The holds are fairly big, but nice and slopey.... Have fun, and bringing a brush is recommended. Cheers.

This route is the route on the lower face of 'The Blonde Formation'. The routes in general are avoided because of the proximity to the road, very close. This route is fairly straightforward but the grade is heightened a little bit due to the lichen covered rock, don't blindy throw for something that looks good on this crag, will be covered for sure.. I would give this route more stars if it weren't so close to the traffic. Watch when approaching the base of this route for rocks rolling onto the road. Be careful and enjoy, bring a brush....
